ABOUT ME

Hi, My name is Paul and im a self taught web developer. Initially my interest in web development was just a hobby that i enjoyed in my spare time, the more i learnt along the way the more interested i became in learning more. I have utilised content on Udemy as well as youTube to develop my skills as a developer to keep up with the fast paced ever evolving learning curve that the web development industry has. Previously i worked as a carpenter for approximately 12 years and although i thoroughly enjoyed my time, I felt like i had plateaud in terms of learning new things and developing new skills. So it was time for a new challenge. The challenge i set for myself was to turn my hobby into my profession and i feel well on the way to reaching my initial goal of landing a job in the industry. Although i feel like there is so much more for me to learn and so many more skills to develop, I feel like i have the skills to be able to contribute in a positive way to any company willing to give me my first opportunity. I like to see opportunities or solutions to problems rather than letting obstacles get in the way. That's basically what development is all about, solving problems to reach a goal. Everything is possible even if it hasn't yet been achieved, with a lot of hard work and determination people can do extraordinary things.

I have gained experience using the following technologies:

  • HTML
  • CSS
  • SASS
  • Bootstrap
  • Javascript
  • React
  • Angular
  • Node.js
  • Git
  • Postman
  • MongoDB
  • ExExpress.js

PROJECTS

GITHUB PROFILE FINDER

This was a project I built while undertaking the React font to back Udemy course by Brad Traversy. The application allows user to search github profiles and displays a custom Github user component with various information taken from the Github API. The application was initially developed using props and was later refactored into functional components that utilised the Context API and hooks to avoid prop drilling. This was en enjoyable project that gave a good insight into the various ways a react application can be built. It gave a good insight into how using the context API can significantly reduce the amount of code needed to produce the application, whilst being very informative about how props are used in React.

PORTFOLIO WEBSITE

My portfolio website i have created to showcase my knowledge of web development for potential employers or clients. A static website built using HTML, SASS and vanilla Javascript. The website is deployed using Netlify via the Github repository. The challenges I faced when building this portfolio was to portray my skills without over complicating things and making it messy. This was also my first time using a CSS preprocesser, SASS to be specific. Using SASS helped to follow the DRY principle by using mixins and avoid writing the same styles over and over again. It was also a great way to be able to seperate code for specific sections of the website using partials, making it easier to find specific style rules and in turn saving time.

SVG ICON DESIGN

This logo i created using the open source software Inkscape. It is a simple representation of my initials but also with a view to the future. My initials will be changing in early 2020 when i get married and will then go from PM to PPM. I wanted to create some kind of logo with this in mind and the logo shown is the one i came up with. It can be viewed as a single P or as two P's, one which is the black color and the other being the negative space inside. I have a good understanding of the Inkscape software and how to utilise it to develop custom SVG's.
